1026  continue;

◆ BotAISetupClient()

int BotAISetupClient ( int  client,
struct bot_settings_s *  settings,

)

Definition at line 1190 of file ai_main.c.

1191 {
1192  char filename[144], name[144], gender[144];
1193  bot_state_t* bs;
1194  int errnum;
1195 
1196  if (!botstates[client]) botstates[client] = G_Alloc(sizeof(bot_state_t));
1197  bs = botstates[client];
1198 
1199  if (!bs) {
1200  return qfalse;
1201  }
1202 
1203  if (bs && bs->inuse) {
1204  BotAI_Print(PRT_FATAL, "BotAISetupClient: client %d already setup\n", client);
1205  return qfalse;
1206  }
1207 
1208  if (!trap_AAS_Initialized()) {
1209  BotAI_Print(PRT_FATAL, "AAS not initialized\n");
1210  return qfalse;
1211  }
1212 
1213  //load the bot character
1214  bs->character = trap_BotLoadCharacter(settings->characterfile, settings->skill);
1215  if (!bs->character) {
1216  BotAI_Print(PRT_FATAL, "couldn't load skill %f from %s\n", settings->skill, settings->characterfile);
1217  return qfalse;
1218  }
1219  //copy the settings
1220  memcpy(&bs->settings, settings, sizeof(bot_settings_t));
1221  //allocate a goal state
1222  bs->gs = trap_BotAllocGoalState(client);
1223  //load the item weights
1224  trap_Characteristic_String(bs->character, CHARACTERISTIC_ITEMWEIGHTS, filename, sizeof(filename));
1225  errnum = trap_BotLoadItemWeights(bs->gs, filename);
1226  if (errnum != BLERR_NOERROR) {
1227  trap_BotFreeGoalState(bs->gs);
1228  return qfalse;
1229  }
1230  //allocate a weapon state
1231  bs->ws = trap_BotAllocWeaponState();
1232  //load the weapon weights
1233  trap_Characteristic_String(bs->character, CHARACTERISTIC_WEAPONWEIGHTS, filename, sizeof(filename));
1234  errnum = trap_BotLoadWeaponWeights(bs->ws, filename);
1235  if (errnum != BLERR_NOERROR) {
1236  trap_BotFreeGoalState(bs->gs);
1237  trap_BotFreeWeaponState(bs->ws);
1238  return qfalse;
1239  }
1240  //allocate a chat state
1241  bs->cs = trap_BotAllocChatState();
1242  //load the chat file
1243  trap_Characteristic_String(bs->character, CHARACTERISTIC_CHAT_FILE, filename, sizeof(filename));
1244  trap_Characteristic_String(bs->character, CHARACTERISTIC_CHAT_NAME, name, sizeof(name));
1245  errnum = trap_BotLoadChatFile(bs->cs, filename, name);
1246  if (errnum != BLERR_NOERROR) {
1247  trap_BotFreeChatState(bs->cs);
1248  trap_BotFreeGoalState(bs->gs);
1249  trap_BotFreeWeaponState(bs->ws);
1250  return qfalse;
1251  }
1252  //get the gender characteristic
1253  trap_Characteristic_String(bs->character, CHARACTERISTIC_GENDER, gender, sizeof(gender));
1254  //set the chat gender
1255  if (*gender == 'f' || *gender == 'F') trap_BotSetChatGender(bs->cs, CHAT_GENDERFEMALE);
1256  else if (*gender == 'm' || *gender == 'M') trap_BotSetChatGender(bs->cs, CHAT_GENDERMALE);
1257  else trap_BotSetChatGender(bs->cs, CHAT_GENDERLESS);
1258 
1259  bs->inuse = qtrue;
1260  bs->client = client;
1261  bs->entitynum = client;
1262  bs->setupcount = 4;
1263  bs->entergame_time = FloatTime();
1264  bs->ms = trap_BotAllocMoveState();
1265  bs->walker = trap_Characteristic_BFloat(bs->character, CHARACTERISTIC_WALKER, 0, 1);
1266  numbots++;
1267 
1268  if (trap_Cvar_VariableIntegerValue("bot_testichat")) {
1269  trap_BotLibVarSet("bot_testichat", "1");
1270  BotChatTest(bs);
1271  }
1272  //NOTE: reschedule the bot thinking
1273  BotScheduleBotThink();
1274  //if interbreeding start with a mutation
1275  if (bot_interbreed) {
1276  trap_BotMutateGoalFuzzyLogic(bs->gs, 1);
1277  }
1278  // if we kept the bot client
1279  if (restart) {
1280  BotReadSessionData(bs);
1281  }
1282  //bot has been setup successfully
1283  return qtrue;
1284 }

1453  // execute bot user commands every frame
1454  for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
1455  if (!botstates[i] || !botstates[i]->inuse) {
1456  continue;
1457  }

1459  continue;
1460  }
1461  botstates[i]->lastucmd.forwardmove = 0;
1462  botstates[i]->lastucmd.rightmove = 0;
1463  botstates[i]->lastucmd.upmove = 0;

1472  trap_BotLibVarSet("memorydump", "1");
1473  trap_Cvar_Set("bot_memorydump", "0");
1474  }

1476  trap_BotLibVarSet("saveroutingcache", "1");
1477  trap_Cvar_Set("bot_saveroutingcache", "0");
1478  }
1479  //check if bot interbreeding is activated
1480  BotInterbreeding();
1481  //cap the bot think time
1482  if (bot_thinktime.integer > 200) {
1483  trap_Cvar_Set("bot_thinktime", "200");
1484  }
1485  //if the bot think time changed we should reschedule the bots
1486  if (bot_thinktime.integer != lastbotthink_time) {
1487  lastbotthink_time = bot_thinktime.integer;
1488  BotScheduleBotThink();
1489  }
1490 
1491  elapsed_time = time - local_time;
1492  local_time = time;
1493 
1494  botlib_residual += elapsed_time;
1495 
1496  if (elapsed_time > bot_thinktime.integer) thinktime = elapsed_time;
1497  else thinktime = bot_thinktime.integer;
1498 
1499  // update the bot library
1500  if (botlib_residual >= thinktime) {
1501  botlib_residual -= thinktime;
1502 
1503  trap_BotLibStartFrame((float)time / 1000);
1504 
1505  if (!trap_AAS_Initialized()) return qfalse;
1506 
1507  //update entities in the botlib
1508  for (i = 0; i < MAX_GENTITIES; i++) {
1509  ent = &g_entities[i];
1510  if (!ent->inuse) {
1511  trap_BotLibUpdateEntity(i, NULL);
1512  continue;
1513  }
1514  if (!ent->r.linked) {
1515  trap_BotLibUpdateEntity(i, NULL);
1516  continue;
1517  }
1518  if (ent->r.svFlags & SVF_NOCLIENT) {
1519  trap_BotLibUpdateEntity(i, NULL);
1520  continue;
1521  }
1522  // do not update missiles
1523  if (ent->s.eType == ET_MISSILE && ent->s.weapon != WP_GRAPPLING_HOOK) {
1524  trap_BotLibUpdateEntity(i, NULL);
1525  continue;
1526  }
1527  // do not update event only entities

1529  trap_BotLibUpdateEntity(i, NULL);
1530  continue;
1531  }

1535  if (ent->touch == ProximityMine_Trigger) {

◆ CalculateRanks()

void CalculateRanks ( void  )

Definition at line 799 of file g_main.c.

800 {
801  int i;
802  int rank;
803  int score;
804  int newScore;
805  gclient_t* cl;
806 
807  level.follow1 = -1;
808  level.follow2 = -1;
809  level.numConnectedClients = 0;
810  level.numNonSpectatorClients = 0;
811  level.numPlayingClients = 0;
812  level.numVotingClients = 0; // don't count bots
813 
814  for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_LEN(level.numteamVotingClients); i++)
815  level.numteamVotingClients[i] = 0;
816 
817  for (i = 0; i < level.maxclients; i++) {
818  if (level.clients[i].pers.connected != CON_DISCONNECTED) {
819  level.sortedClients[level.numConnectedClients] = i;
820  level.numConnectedClients++;
821 
822  if (level.clients[i].sess.sessionTeam != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
823  level.numNonSpectatorClients++;
824 
825  // decide if this should be auto-followed
826  if (level.clients[i].pers.connected == CON_CONNECTED) {
827  level.numPlayingClients++;
828  if (!(g_entities[i].r.svFlags & SVF_BOT)) {
829  level.numVotingClients++;
830  if (level.clients[i].sess.sessionTeam == TEAM_RED)
831  level.numteamVotingClients[0]++;
832  else if (level.clients[i].sess.sessionTeam == TEAM_BLUE)
833  level.numteamVotingClients[1]++;
834  }
835  if (level.follow1 == -1) {
836  level.follow1 = i;
837  } else if (level.follow2 == -1) {
838  level.follow2 = i;
839  }
840  }
841  }
842  }
843  }
844 
845  qsort(level.sortedClients, level.numConnectedClients,
846  sizeof(level.sortedClients[0]), SortRanks);
847 
848  // set the rank value for all clients that are connected and not spectators
849  if (g_gametype.integer >= GT_TEAM) {
850  // in team games, rank is just the order of the teams, 0=red, 1=blue, 2=tied
851  for (i = 0; i < level.numConnectedClients; i++) {
852  cl = &level.clients[level.sortedClients[i]];
853  if (level.teamScores[TEAM_RED] == level.teamScores[TEAM_BLUE]) {
854  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] = 2;
855  } else if (level.teamScores[TEAM_RED] > level.teamScores[TEAM_BLUE]) {
856  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] = 0;
857  } else {
858  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] = 1;
859  }
860  }
861  } else {
862  rank = -1;
863  score = 0;
864  for (i = 0; i < level.numPlayingClients; i++) {
865  cl = &level.clients[level.sortedClients[i]];
866  newScore = cl->ps.persistant[PERS_SCORE];
867  if (i == 0 || newScore != score) {
868  rank = i;
869  // assume we aren't tied until the next client is checked
870  level.clients[level.sortedClients[i]].ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] = rank;
871  } else {
872  // we are tied with the previous client
873  level.clients[level.sortedClients[i - 1]].ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] = rank | RANK_TIED_FLAG;
874  level.clients[level.sortedClients[i]].ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] = rank | RANK_TIED_FLAG;
875  }
876  score = newScore;
877  if (g_gametype.integer == GT_SINGLE_PLAYER && level.numPlayingClients == 1) {
878  level.clients[level.sortedClients[i]].ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] = rank | RANK_TIED_FLAG;
879  }
880  }
881  }
882 
883  // set the CS_SCORES1/2 configstrings, which will be visible to everyone
884  if (g_gametype.integer >= GT_TEAM) {
885  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES1, va("%i", level.teamScores[TEAM_RED]));
886  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES2, va("%i", level.teamScores[TEAM_BLUE]));
887  } else {
888  if (level.numConnectedClients == 0) {
889  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES1, va("%i", SCORE_NOT_PRESENT));
890  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES2, va("%i", SCORE_NOT_PRESENT));
891  } else if (level.numConnectedClients == 1) {
892  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES1, va("%i", level.clients[level.sortedClients[0]].ps.persistant[PERS_SCORE]));
893  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES2, va("%i", SCORE_NOT_PRESENT));
894  } else {
895  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES1, va("%i", level.clients[level.sortedClients[0]].ps.persistant[PERS_SCORE]));
896  trap_SetConfigstring(CS_SCORES2, va("%i", level.clients[level.sortedClients[1]].ps.persistant[PERS_SCORE]));
897  }
898  }
899 
900  // see if it is time to end the level
901  CheckExitRules();
902 
903  // if we are at the intermission, send the new info to everyone
904  if (level.intermissiontime) {
905  SendScoreboardMessageToAllClients();
906  }
907 }

◆ ClientBegin()

void ClientBegin ( int  clientNum)

ClientBegin is called when a client has finished connecting, and is ready to be placed into the level.

This will happen every level load, and on transition between teams, but doesn't happen on respawns.

Definition at line 983 of file g_client.c.

984 {
985  gentity_t* ent;
986  gclient_t* client;
987  int flags;
988 
989  ent = g_entities + clientNum;
990 
991  client = level.clients + clientNum;
992 
993  if (ent->r.linked)
994  trap_UnlinkEntity(ent);
995 
996  G_InitGentity(ent);
997  ent->touch = 0;
998  ent->pain = 0;
999  ent->client = client;
1000 
1001  client->pers.connected = CON_CONNECTED;
1002  client->pers.enterTime = level.time;
1003  client->pers.teamState.state = TEAM_BEGIN;
1004 
1005  // save eflags around this, because changing teams will
1006  // cause this to happen with a valid entity, and we
1007  // want to make sure the teleport bit is set right
1008  // so the viewpoint doesn't interpolate through the
1009  // world to the new position

1025 }

◆ ClientConnect()

char* ClientConnect ( int  clientNum,

qboolean  isBot 
)

Definition at line 885 of file g_client.c.

886 {
887  char* value;
888  // char *areabits;
889  gclient_t* client;
890  char userinfo[MAX_INFO_STRING];
891  gentity_t* ent;
892 
893  ent = &g_entities[clientNum];
894 
895  trap_GetUserinfo(clientNum, userinfo, sizeof(userinfo));
896 
897  // IP filtering
898  // https://zerowing.idsoftware.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=500
899  // recommanding PB based IP / GUID banning, the builtin system is pretty limited
900  // check to see if they are on the banned IP list
901  value = Info_ValueForKey(userinfo, "ip");
902  if (G_FilterPacket(value)) {
903  return "You are banned from this server.";
904  }
905 
906  // we don't check password for bots and local client
907  // NOTE: local client <-> "ip" "localhost"
908  // this means this client is not running in our current process
909  if (!isBot && (strcmp(value, "localhost") != 0)) {
910  // check for a password
911  value = Info_ValueForKey(userinfo, "password");
912  if (g_password.string[0] && Q_stricmp(g_password.string, "none") &&
913  strcmp(g_password.string, value) != 0) {
914  return "Invalid password";
915  }
916  }
917  // if a player reconnects quickly after a disconnect, the client disconnect may never be called, thus flag can get lost in the ether
918  if (ent->inuse) {
919  G_LogPrintf("Forcing disconnect on active client: %i\n", clientNum);
920  // so lets just fix up anything that should happen on a disconnect
921  ClientDisconnect(clientNum);
922  }
923  // they can connect
924  ent->client = level.clients + clientNum;
925  client = ent->client;
926 
927  // areabits = client->areabits;
928 
929  memset(client, 0, sizeof(*client));
930 
931  client->pers.connected = CON_CONNECTING;
932 
933  // check for local client
934  value = Info_ValueForKey(userinfo, "ip");
935  if (!strcmp(value, "localhost")) {
936  client->pers.localClient = qtrue;
937  }
938 
939  if (isBot) {
940  ent->r.svFlags |= SVF_BOT;
941  ent->inuse = qtrue;
942  if (!G_BotConnect(clientNum, !firstTime)) {
943  return "BotConnectfailed";
944  }
945  }
946 
947  // read or initialize the session data
948  if (firstTime || level.newSession) {
949  G_InitSessionData(client, userinfo);
950  }
951  G_ReadSessionData(client);
952 
953  // get and distribute relevant parameters
954  G_LogPrintf("ClientConnect: %i\n", clientNum);
955  ClientUserinfoChanged(clientNum);
956 
957  // don't do the "xxx connected" messages if they were caried over from previous level
958  if (firstTime) {
959  trap_SendServerCommand(-1, va("print \"%s" S_COLOR_WHITE " connected\n\"", client->pers.netname));
960  }
961 
962  if (g_gametype.integer >= GT_TEAM &&
963  client->sess.sessionTeam != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
964  BroadcastTeamChange(client, -1);
965  }
966 
967  // count current clients and rank for scoreboard
968  CalculateRanks();
969 
970  // for statistics
971 // client->areabits = areabits;
972 // if ( !client->areabits )
973 // client->areabits = G_Alloc( (trap_AAS_PointReachabilityAreaIndex( NULL ) + 7) / 8 );
974 
975  return NULL;
976 }

◆ ClientDisconnect()

void ClientDisconnect ( int  clientNum)

Definition at line 1246 of file g_client.c.

1247 {
1248  gentity_t* ent;
1249  gentity_t* tent;
1250  int i;
1251 
1252  // cleanup if we are kicking a bot that
1253  // hasn't spawned yet
1254  G_RemoveQueuedBotBegin(clientNum);
1255 
1256  ent = g_entities + clientNum;
1257  if (!ent->client || ent->client->pers.connected == CON_DISCONNECTED) {
1258  return;
1259  }
1260 
1261  // stop any following clients
1262  for (i = 0; i < level.maxclients; i++) {
1263  if (level.clients[i].sess.sessionTeam == TEAM_SPECTATOR
1264  && level.clients[i].sess.spectatorState == SPECTATOR_FOLLOW
1265  && level.clients[i].sess.spectatorClient == clientNum) {
1266  StopFollowing(&g_entities[i]);
1267  }
1268  }
1269 
1270  // send effect if they were completely connected
1271  if (ent->client->pers.connected == CON_CONNECTED
1272  && ent->client->sess.sessionTeam != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
1273  tent = G_TempEntity(ent->client->ps.origin, EV_PLAYER_TELEPORT_OUT);
1274  tent->s.clientNum = ent->s.clientNum;
1275 
1276  // They don't get to take powerups with them!
1277  // Especially important for stuff like CTF flags
1278  TossClientItems(ent);
1279 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1280  TossClientPersistantPowerups(ent);
1281  if (g_gametype.integer == GT_HARVESTER) {
1282  TossClientCubes(ent);
1283  }
1284 #endif
1285 
1286  }
1287 
1288  G_LogPrintf("ClientDisconnect: %i\n", clientNum);
1289 
1290  // if we are playing in tourney mode and losing, give a win to the other player

1292  && !level.intermissiontime
1293  && !level.warmupTime && level.sortedClients[1] == clientNum) {
1294  level.clients[level.sortedClients[0]].sess.wins++;
1295  ClientUserinfoChanged(level.sortedClients[0]);
1296  }
1297

1299  ent->client->sess.sessionTeam == TEAM_FREE &&
1300  level.intermissiontime) {
1301 
1302  trap_SendConsoleCommand(EXEC_APPEND, "map_restart 0\n");
1303  level.restarted = qtrue;
1304  level.changemap = NULL;
1305  level.intermissiontime = 0;
1306  }
1307 
1308  trap_UnlinkEntity(ent);
1309  ent->s.modelindex = 0;
1310  ent->inuse = qfalse;
1311  ent->classname = "disconnected";
1312  ent->client->pers.connected = CON_DISCONNECTED;
1313  ent->client->ps.persistant[PERS_TEAM] = TEAM_FREE;
1314  ent->client->sess.sessionTeam = TEAM_FREE;

1322  }
1323 }

794  }
795  // don't ever use a default skin in teamplay, it would just waste memory
796  // however bots will always join a team but they spawn in as spectator
797  if ( g_gametype.integer >= GT_TEAM && team == TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
798  ForceClientSkin(client, model, "red");
799  // ForceClientSkin(client, headModel, "red");
800  }
801  */
802 
803 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
804  if (g_gametype.integer >= GT_TEAM && !(ent->r.svFlags & SVF_BOT)) {
805  client->pers.teamInfo = qtrue;
806  } else {
807  s = Info_ValueForKey(userinfo, "teamoverlay");
808  if (!*s || atoi(s) != 0) {
809  client->pers.teamInfo = qtrue;
810  } else {
811  client->pers.teamInfo = qfalse;
812  }
813  }
814 #else

828  else {
829  client->pers.pmoveFixed = qtrue;

861  G_LogPrintf("ClientUserinfoChanged: %i %s\n", clientNum, s);
862 }

◆ Cmd_FollowCycle_f()

void Cmd_FollowCycle_f ( gentity_t *  ent,
int  dir 
)

Definition at line 783 of file g_cmds.c.

784 {
785  int clientnum;
786  int original;
787 
788  // if they are playing a tournement game, count as a loss
789  if ((g_gametype.integer == GT_TOURNAMENT)
790  && ent->client->sess.sessionTeam == TEAM_FREE) {
791  ent->client->sess.losses++;
792  }
793  // first set them to spectator
794  if (ent->client->sess.spectatorState == SPECTATOR_NOT) {
795  SetTeam(ent, "spectator");
796  }
797 
798  if (dir != 1 && dir != -1) {
799  G_Error("Cmd_FollowCycle_f: bad dir %i", dir);
800  }
801 
802  // if dedicated follow client, just switch between the two auto clients
803  if (ent->client->sess.spectatorClient < 0) {
804  if (ent->client->sess.spectatorClient == -1) {
805  ent->client->sess.spectatorClient = -2;
806  } else if (ent->client->sess.spectatorClient == -2) {
807  ent->client->sess.spectatorClient = -1;
808  }
809  return;
810  }
811 
812  clientnum = ent->client->sess.spectatorClient;
813  original = clientnum;
814  do {
815  clientnum += dir;
816  if (clientnum >= level.maxclients) {
817  clientnum = 0;
818  }
819  if (clientnum < 0) {
820  clientnum = level.maxclients - 1;
821  }
822 
823  // can only follow connected clients
824  if (level.clients[clientnum].pers.connected != CON_CONNECTED) {
825  continue;
826  }
827 
828  // can't follow another spectator
829  if (level.clients[clientnum].sess.sessionTeam == TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
830  continue;
831  }
832 
833  // this is good, we can use it
834  ent->client->sess.spectatorClient = clientnum;
835  ent->client->sess.spectatorState = SPECTATOR_FOLLOW;
836  return;
837  } while (clientnum != original);
838 
839  // leave it where it was
840 }

◆ DeathmatchScoreboardMessage()

void DeathmatchScoreboardMessage ( gentity_t *  ent)

Definition at line 35 of file g_cmds.c.

36 {
37  char entry[1024];
38  char string[1000];
39  int stringlength;
40  int i, j;
41  gclient_t* cl;
42  int numSorted, scoreFlags, accuracy, perfect;
43 
44  // don't send scores to bots, they don't parse it
45  if (ent->r.svFlags & SVF_BOT) {
46  return;
47  }
48 
49  // send the latest information on all clients
50  string[0] = 0;
51  stringlength = 0;
52  scoreFlags = 0;
53 
54  numSorted = level.numConnectedClients;
55 
56  for (i = 0; i < numSorted; i++) {
57  int ping;
58 
59  cl = &level.clients[level.sortedClients[i]];
60 
61  if (cl->pers.connected == CON_CONNECTING) {
62  ping = -1;
63  } else {
64  ping = cl->ps.ping < 999 ? cl->ps.ping : 999;
65  }
66 
67  if (cl->accuracy_shots) {
68  accuracy = cl->accuracy_hits * 100 / cl->accuracy_shots;
69  } else {
70  accuracy = 0;
71  }
72  perfect = (cl->ps.persistant[PERS_RANK] == 0 && cl->ps.persistant[PERS_KILLED] == 0) ? 1 : 0;
73 
74  Com_sprintf(entry, sizeof(entry),
75  " %i %i %i %i %i %i %i %i %i %i %i %i %i %i", level.sortedClients[i],
76  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_SCORE], ping, (level.time - cl->pers.enterTime) / 60000,
77  scoreFlags, g_entities[level.sortedClients[i]].s.powerups, accuracy,
78  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_IMPRESSIVE_COUNT],
79  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_EXCELLENT_COUNT],
80  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_GAUNTLET_FRAG_COUNT],
81  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_DEFEND_COUNT],
82  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_ASSIST_COUNT],
83  perfect,
84  cl->ps.persistant[PERS_CAPTURES]);
85  j = strlen(entry);
86  if (stringlength + j >= sizeof(string))
87  break;
88  strcpy(string + stringlength, entry);
89  stringlength += j;
90  }
91 
92  trap_SendServerCommand(ent - g_entities, va("scores %i %i %i%s", i,
93  level.teamScores[TEAM_RED], level.teamScores[TEAM_BLUE],
94  string));
95 }

703  ent->s.eFlags |= EF_NODRAW;
704  ent->r.contents = 0;
705  return;

717  return;
718  }

722 }

626  bolt->s.weapon = WP_BFG;
627  bolt->r.ownerNum = self->s.number;
628  bolt->parent = self;
629  bolt->damage = 100;
630  bolt->splashDamage = 100;
631  bolt->splashRadius = 120;
632  bolt->methodOfDeath = MOD_BFG;
633  bolt->splashMethodOfDeath = MOD_BFG_SPLASH;
634  bolt->clipmask = MASK_SHOT;
635  bolt->target_ent = NULL;
636 
637  bolt->s.pos.trType = TR_LINEAR;
638  bolt->s.pos.trTime = level.time - MISSILE_PRESTEP_TIME; // move a bit on the very first frame
639  VectorCopy(start, bolt->s.pos.trBase);
640  VectorScale(dir, 2000, bolt->s.pos.trDelta);
641  SnapVector(bolt->s.pos.trDelta); // save net bandwidth
642  VectorCopy(start, bolt->r.currentOrigin);
643 
644  return bolt;
645 }

◆ fire_rocket()

gentity_t* fire_rocket ( gentity_t *  self,
vec3_t  start,
vec3_t  dir 
)

This function is responsible for creating an entity and defining it as a rocket (also called a missile).

Parameters
[in]selfThe parent entity (owner).
[in]startA starting location.
[in]dirA direction to face.
Returns
The spawned entity.

Definition at line 663 of file g_missile.c.

664 {
665  gentity_t* bolt;
666 
667  VectorNormalize(dir);
668 
669  bolt = G_Spawn(); // Either finds a free entity or creates one.
670  bolt->classname = "rocket";
671  bolt->nextthink = level.time + 15000; // Set the time until the next think period.
672  bolt->think = G_ExplodeMissile; // Specifies which think function will be called.
673  bolt->s.eType = ET_MISSILE; // Type of bolt.
674  bolt->r.svFlags = SVF_USE_CURRENT_ORIGIN;// Link position.
675  bolt->s.weapon = WP_ROCKET_LAUNCHER; // The weapon it was fired from.
676  bolt->r.ownerNum = self->s.number; // Its owner.
677  bolt->parent = self;
678 
679  bolt->damage = 100;
680  bolt->splashDamage = 100; // Indirect damage.
681  bolt->splashRadius = 120;
682  bolt->methodOfDeath = MOD_ROCKET;
683  bolt->splashMethodOfDeath = MOD_ROCKET_SPLASH;
684  bolt->clipmask = MASK_SHOT;
685  bolt->target_ent = NULL;
686 
687  bolt->s.pos.trType = TR_LINEAR;
688  bolt->s.pos.trTime = level.time - MISSILE_PRESTEP_TIME; // move a bit on the very first frame
689  VectorCopy(start, bolt->s.pos.trBase);
690  VectorScale(dir, 900, bolt->s.pos.trDelta); // Fired at 900 units/sec.
691  SnapVector(bolt->s.pos.trDelta); // save net bandwidth
692  VectorCopy(start, bolt->r.currentOrigin);
693 
694  return bolt;
695 }

void FireWeapon ( gentity_t *  ent)

834  s_quadFactor = g_quadfactor.value;
835  } else {
836  s_quadFactor = 1;
837  }
838 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
839  if (ent->client->persistantPowerup && ent->client->persistantPowerup->item && ent->client->persistantPowerup->item->giTag == PW_DOUBLER) {
840  s_quadFactor *= 2;
841  }
842 #endif
843 
844  // track shots taken for accuracy tracking. Grapple is not a weapon and gauntet is just not tracked
845  if (ent->s.weapon != WP_GRAPPLING_HOOK && ent->s.weapon != WP_GAUNTLET) {
846 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
847  if (ent->s.weapon == WP_NAILGUN) {
848  ent->client->accuracy_shots += NUM_NAILSHOTS;
849  } else {
850  ent->client->accuracy_shots++;
851  }
852 #else
853  ent->client->accuracy_shots++;
854 #endif
855  }
856 
857  // set aiming directions
858  AngleVectors(ent->client->ps.viewangles, forward, right, up);
859 
860  CalcMuzzlePointOrigin(ent, ent->client->oldOrigin, forward, right, up, muzzle);
861 
862  // fire the specific weapon
863  switch (ent->s.weapon) {
864  case WP_GAUNTLET:
865  Weapon_Gauntlet(ent);
866  break;
867  case WP_LIGHTNING:
868  Weapon_LightningFire(ent);
869  break;
870  case WP_SHOTGUN:
871  weapon_supershotgun_fire(ent);
872  break;
873  case WP_MACHINEGUN:
874  if (g_gametype.integer != GT_TEAM) {
875  Bullet_Fire(ent, MACHINEGUN_SPREAD, MACHINEGUN_DAMAGE, MOD_MACHINEGUN);
876  } else {
877  Bullet_Fire(ent, MACHINEGUN_SPREAD, MACHINEGUN_TEAM_DAMAGE, MOD_MACHINEGUN);
878  }
879  break;
880  case WP_GRENADE_LAUNCHER:
881  weapon_grenadelauncher_fire(ent);
882  break;
883  case WP_ROCKET_LAUNCHER:
884  Weapon_RocketLauncher_Fire(ent);
885  break;
886  case WP_PLASMAGUN:
887  Weapon_Plasmagun_Fire(ent);
888  break;
889  case WP_RAILGUN:
890  weapon_railgun_fire(ent);
891  break;
892  case WP_BFG:
893  BFG_Fire(ent);
894  break;
895  case WP_GRAPPLING_HOOK:
896  Weapon_GrapplingHook_Fire(ent);
897  break;
898 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
899  case WP_NAILGUN:
900  Weapon_Nailgun_Fire(ent);
901  break;
902  case WP_PROX_LAUNCHER:
903  weapon_proxlauncher_fire(ent);
904  break;
905  case WP_CHAINGUN:
906  Bullet_Fire(ent, CHAINGUN_SPREAD, CHAINGUN_DAMAGE, MOD_CHAINGUN);
907  break;
908 #endif
909  default:
910  // FIXME G_Error( "Bad ent->s.weapon" );
911  break;
912  }
913 }

799 #endif
800 }

References BG_FindItem(), bg_itemlist, FOFS, G_Find(), g_gametype, G_Printf(), GT_1FCTF, GT_CTF, GT_HARVESTER, GT_OBELISK, itemRegistered, NULL, S_COLOR_YELLOW, and Team_InitGame().

Referenced by G_InitGame().

◆ G_Damage()

void G_Damage ( gentity_t *  targ,
gentity_t *  inflictor,
gentity_t *  attacker,
vec3_t  dir,
vec3_t  point,
int  damage,
int  dflags,
int  mod 
)

The damage is dealt out, if all signs indicate that the bullet hit a surface that can be damaged.

Parameters
targThe entity in the game that will receive the damage.
inflictorThe entity that caused the damage, in a literal sense. This could be a bullet, a grenade, a rocket, and so on.
attackerThe entity that caused the inflictor to do damage. An example is the player who fired the shotgun.
dirThis is the direction of knock back for the target. Some items cause so much damage that the target may be thrown back from the blow.
pointThis is the point of actual contact where the damage is done. This is a good reference point in case you want to look for damage in specific areas on the target, such as a headshot.
damageThe total amount of damage being dealt to the target.
dflagsSome types of damage can be specialized or flagged to behave differently within Q3. This is where the damage flags are passed in. An example of available dflags is DAMAGE_NO_ARMOR: the damage ignores players armor.
modThese are flags that tell the function what will be considered the means of death in case it is to be determined at a later point. (For example, if you want to track a certain weapons usage and effectiveness).

Definition at line 832 of file g_combat.c.

834 {
835  gclient_t* client;
836  int take;
837  int asave;
838  int knockback;
839  int max;
840 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
841  vec3_t bouncedir, impactpoint;
842 #endif
843 
844  if (!targ->takedamage) {
845  return;
846  }
847 
848  // the intermission has already been qualified for, so don't
849  // allow any extra scoring
850  if (level.intermissionQueued) {
851  return;
852  }
853 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
854  if (targ->client && mod != MOD_JUICED) {
855  if (targ->client->invulnerabilityTime > level.time) {
856  if (dir && point) {
857  G_InvulnerabilityEffect(targ, dir, point, impactpoint, bouncedir);
858  }
859  return;
860  }
861  }
862 #endif
863  if (!inflictor) {
864  inflictor = &g_entities[ENTITYNUM_WORLD];
865  }
866  if (!attacker) {
867  attacker = &g_entities[ENTITYNUM_WORLD];
868  }
869 
870  // shootable doors / buttons don't actually have any health
871  if (targ->s.eType == ET_MOVER) {
872  if (targ->use && targ->moverState == MOVER_POS1) {
873  targ->use(targ, inflictor, attacker);
874  }
875  return;
876  }
877 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
878  if (g_gametype.integer == GT_OBELISK && CheckObeliskAttack(targ, attacker)) {
879  return;
880  }
881 #endif
882  // reduce damage by the attacker's handicap value
883  // unless they are rocket jumping
884  if (attacker->client && attacker != targ) {
885  max = attacker->client->ps.stats[STAT_MAX_HEALTH];
886 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
887  if (bg_itemlist[attacker->client->ps.stats[STAT_PERSISTANT_POWERUP]].giTag == PW_GUARD) {
888  max /= 2;
889  }
890 #endif
891  damage = damage * max / 100;
892  }
893 
894  client = targ->client;
895 
896  if (client) {
897  if (client->noclip) {
898  return;
899  }
900  }
901 
902  if (!dir) {
903  dflags |= DAMAGE_NO_KNOCKBACK;
904  } else {
905  VectorNormalize(dir);
906  }
907 
908  knockback = damage;
909  if (knockback > 200) {
910  knockback = 200;
911  }
912  if (targ->flags & FL_NO_KNOCKBACK) {
913  knockback = 0;
914  }
915  if (dflags & DAMAGE_NO_KNOCKBACK) {
916  knockback = 0;
917  }
918 
919  // figure momentum add, even if the damage won't be taken
920  if (knockback && targ->client) {
921  vec3_t kvel;
922  float mass;
923 
924  mass = 200;
925 
926  VectorScale(dir, g_knockback.value * (float)knockback / mass, kvel);
927  VectorAdd(targ->client->ps.velocity, kvel, targ->client->ps.velocity);
928 
929  // set the timer so that the other client can't cancel
930  // out the movement immediately
931  if (!targ->client->ps.pm_time) {
932  int t;
933 
934  t = knockback * 2;
935  if (t < 50) {
936  t = 50;
937  }
938  if (t > 200) {
939  t = 200;
940  }
941  targ->client->ps.pm_time = t;
942  targ->client->ps.pm_flags |= PMF_TIME_KNOCKBACK;
943  }
944  }
945 
946  // check for completely getting out of the damage
947  if (!(dflags & DAMAGE_NO_PROTECTION)) {
948 
949  // if TF_NO_FRIENDLY_FIRE is set, don't do damage to the target
950  // if the attacker was on the same team
951 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
952  if (mod != MOD_JUICED && targ != attacker && !(dflags & DAMAGE_NO_TEAM_PROTECTION) && OnSameTeam(targ, attacker)) {
953 #else
954  if (targ != attacker && OnSameTeam(targ, attacker)) {
955 #endif
956  if (!g_friendlyFire.integer) {
957  return;
958  }
959  }
960 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
961  if (mod == MOD_PROXIMITY_MINE) {
962  if (inflictor && inflictor->parent && OnSameTeam(targ, inflictor->parent)) {
963  return;
964  }
965  if (targ == attacker) {
966  return;
967  }
968  }
969 #endif
970 
971  // check for godmode
972  if (targ->flags & FL_GODMODE) {
973  return;
974  }
975  }
976 
977  // battlesuit protects from all radius damage (but takes knockback)
978  // and protects 50% against all damage
979  if (client && client->ps.powerups[PW_BATTLESUIT]) {
980  G_AddEvent(targ, EV_POWERUP_BATTLESUIT, 0);
981  if ((dflags & DAMAGE_RADIUS) || (mod == MOD_FALLING)) {
982  return;
983  }
984  damage *= 0.5;
985  }
986 
987  // add to the attacker's hit counter (if the target isn't a general entity like a prox mine)
988  if (attacker->client && client
989  && targ != attacker && targ->health > 0
990  && targ->s.eType != ET_MISSILE
991  && targ->s.eType != ET_GENERAL) {
992  if (OnSameTeam(targ, attacker)) {
993  attacker->client->ps.persistant[PERS_HITS]--;
994  } else {
995  attacker->client->ps.persistant[PERS_HITS]++;
996  }
997  attacker->client->ps.persistant[PERS_ATTACKEE_ARMOR] = (targ->health << 8) | (client->ps.stats[STAT_ARMOR]);
998  }
999 
1000  // always give half damage if hurting self
1001  // calculated after knockback, so rocket jumping works
1002  if (targ == attacker) {
1003  damage *= 0.5;
1004  }
1005 
1006  if (damage < 1) {
1007  damage = 1;
1008  }
1009  take = damage;
1010 
1011  // save some from armor
1012  asave = CheckArmor(targ, take, dflags);
1013  take -= asave;
1014 
1015  if (g_debugDamage.integer) {
1016  G_Printf("%i: client:%i health:%i damage:%i armor:%i\n", level.time, targ->s.number,
1017  targ->health, take, asave);
1018  }
1019 
1020  // add to the damage inflicted on a player this frame
1021  // the total will be turned into screen blends and view angle kicks
1022  // at the end of the frame
1023  if (client) {
1024  if (attacker) {
1025  client->ps.persistant[PERS_ATTACKER] = attacker->s.number;
1026  } else {
1027  client->ps.persistant[PERS_ATTACKER] = ENTITYNUM_WORLD;
1028  }
1029  client->damage_armor += asave;
1030  client->damage_blood += take;
1031  client->damage_knockback += knockback;
1032  if (dir) {
1033  VectorCopy(dir, client->damage_from);
1034  client->damage_fromWorld = qfalse;
1035  } else {
1036  VectorCopy(targ->r.currentOrigin, client->damage_from);
1037  client->damage_fromWorld = qtrue;
1038  }
1039  }
1040 
1041  // See if it's the player hurting the emeny flag carrier
1042 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
1043  if (g_gametype.integer == GT_CTF || g_gametype.integer == GT_1FCTF) {
1044 #else
1045  if (g_gametype.integer == GT_CTF) {
1046 #endif
1047  Team_CheckHurtCarrier(targ, attacker);
1048  }
1049 
1050  if (targ->client) {
1051  // set the last client who damaged the target
1052  targ->client->lasthurt_client = attacker->s.number;
1053  targ->client->lasthurt_mod = mod;
1054  }
1055 
1056  // do the damage
1057  if (take) {
1058  targ->health = targ->health - take;
1059  if (targ->client) {
1060  targ->client->ps.stats[STAT_HEALTH] = targ->health;
1061  }
1062 
1063  if (targ->health <= 0) {
1064  if (client)
1065  targ->flags |= FL_NO_KNOCKBACK;
1066 
1067  if (targ->health < -999)
1068  targ->health = -999;
1069 
1070  targ->enemy = attacker;
1071  targ->die(targ, inflictor, attacker, take, mod);
1072  return;
1073  } else if (targ->pain) {
1074  targ->pain(targ, attacker, take);
1075  }
1076  }
1077 
1078 }

142  sess->sessionTeam = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
143  } else {
144  sess->sessionTeam = TEAM_FREE;
145  }
146  break;
147  case GT_TOURNAMENT:
148  // if the game is full, go into a waiting mode

150  sess->sessionTeam = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
151  } else {
152  sess->sessionTeam = TEAM_FREE;
153  }
154  break;
155  }
156  }
157 
158  sess->spectatorState = SPECTATOR_FREE;
159  }
160 
161  AddTournamentQueue(client);
162 
163  G_WriteClientSessionData(client);
164 }

◆ G_RadiusDamage()

qboolean G_RadiusDamage ( vec3_t  origin,
gentity_t *  attacker,
float  damage,
float  radius,
gentity_t *  ignore,
int  mod 
)

Definition at line 1191 of file g_combat.c.

1193 {
1194  float points, dist;
1195  gentity_t* ent;
1196  int entityList[MAX_GENTITIES];
1197  int numListedEntities;
1198  vec3_t mins, maxs;
1199  vec3_t v;
1200  vec3_t dir;
1201  int i, e;
1202  qboolean hitClient = qfalse;
1203 
1204  if (radius < 1) {
1205  radius = 1;
1206  }
1207 
1208  for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
1209  mins[i] = origin[i] - radius;
1210  maxs[i] = origin[i] + radius;
1211  }
1212 
1213  numListedEntities = trap_EntitiesInBox(mins, maxs, entityList, MAX_GENTITIES);
1214 
1215  for (e = 0; e < numListedEntities; e++) {
1216  ent = &g_entities[entityList[e]];
1217 
1218  if (ent == ignore)
1219  continue;
1220  if (!ent->takedamage)
1221  continue;
1222 
1223  // find the distance from the edge of the bounding box
1224  for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
1225  if (origin[i] < ent->r.absmin[i]) {
1226  v[i] = ent->r.absmin[i] - origin[i];
1227  } else if (origin[i] > ent->r.absmax[i]) {
1228  v[i] = origin[i] - ent->r.absmax[i];
1229  } else {
1230  v[i] = 0;
1231  }
1232  }
1233 
1234  dist = VectorLength(v);
1235  if (dist >= radius) {
1236  continue;
1237  }
1238 
1239  points = damage * (1.0 - dist / radius);
1240 
1241  if (CanDamage(ent, origin)) {
1242  if (LogAccuracyHit(ent, attacker)) {
1243  hitClient = qtrue;
1244  }
1245  VectorSubtract(ent->r.currentOrigin, origin, dir);
1246  // push the center of mass higher than the origin so players
1247  // get knocked into the air more
1248  dir[2] += 24;
1249  G_Damage(ent, NULL, attacker, dir, origin, (int)points, DAMAGE_RADIUS, mod);
1250  }
1251  }
1252 
1253  return hitClient;
1254 }

References entityShared_t::absmax, entityShared_t::absmin, CanDamage(), entityShared_t::currentOrigin, DAMAGE_RADIUS, G_Damage(), g_entities, LogAccuracyHit(), MAX_GENTITIES, NULL, qfalse, qtrue, gentity_s::r, gentity_s::takedamage, trap_EntitiesInBox(), VectorLength(), and VectorSubtract.

◆ G_RunMissile()

void G_RunMissile ( gentity_t *  ent)

Definition at line 455 of file g_missile.c.

456 {
457  vec3_t origin;
458  trace_t tr;
459  int passent;
460 
461  // get current position
462  BG_EvaluateTrajectory(&ent->s.pos, level.time, origin);
463 
464  // if this missile bounced off an invulnerability sphere
465  if (ent->target_ent) {
466  passent = ent->target_ent->s.number;
467  }
468 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
469  // prox mines that left the owner bbox will attach to anything, even the owner
470  else if (ent->s.weapon == WP_PROX_LAUNCHER && ent->count) {
471  passent = ENTITYNUM_NONE;
472  }
473 #endif
474  else {
475  // ignore interactions with the missile owner
476  passent = ent->r.ownerNum;
477  }
478  // trace a line from the previous position to the current position
479  trap_Trace(&tr, ent->r.currentOrigin, ent->r.mins, ent->r.maxs, origin, passent, ent->clipmask);
480 
481  if (tr.startsolid || tr.allsolid) {
482  // make sure the tr.entityNum is set to the entity we're stuck in
483  trap_Trace(&tr, ent->r.currentOrigin, ent->r.mins, ent->r.maxs, ent->r.currentOrigin, passent, ent->clipmask);
484  tr.fraction = 0;
485  } else {
486  VectorCopy(tr.endpos, ent->r.currentOrigin);
487  }
488 
489  trap_LinkEntity(ent);
490 
491  if (tr.fraction != 1) {
492  // never explode or bounce on sky
493  if (tr.surfaceFlags & SURF_NOIMPACT) {
494  // If grapple, reset owner
495  if (ent->parent && ent->parent->client && ent->parent->client->hook == ent) {
496  ent->parent->client->hook = NULL;
497  }
498  G_FreeEntity(ent);
499  return;
500  }
501  G_MissileImpact(ent, &tr);
502  if (ent->s.eType != ET_MISSILE) {
503  return; // exploded
504  }
505  }
506 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
507  // if the prox mine wasn't yet outside the player body
508  if (ent->s.weapon == WP_PROX_LAUNCHER && !ent->count) {
509  // check if the prox mine is outside the owner bbox
510  trap_Trace(&tr, ent->r.currentOrigin, ent->r.mins, ent->r.maxs, ent->r.currentOrigin, ENTITYNUM_NONE, ent->clipmask);
511  if (!tr.startsolid || tr.entityNum != ent->r.ownerNum) {
512  ent->count = 1;
513  }
514  }
515 #endif
516  // check think function after bouncing
517  G_RunThink(ent);
518 }

References BG_EvaluateTrajectory(), gentity_s::client, gentity_s::clipmask, gentity_s::count, entityShared_t::currentOrigin, ENTITYNUM_NONE, ET_MISSILE, entityState_s::eType, G_FreeEntity(), G_MissileImpact(), G_RunThink(), gclient_s::hook, level, entityShared_t::maxs, entityShared_t::mins, NULL, entityState_s::number, entityShared_t::ownerNum, gentity_s::parent, entityState_s::pos, gentity_s::r, gentity_s::s, SURF_NOIMPACT, gentity_s::target_ent, level_locals_t::time, tr, trap_LinkEntity(), trap_Trace(), VectorCopy, and entityState_s::weapon.

◆ G_Spawn()

gentity_t* G_Spawn ( void  )

Definition at line 397 of file g_utils.c.

398 {
399  int i, force;
400  gentity_t* e;
401 
402  e = NULL; // shut up warning
403  for (force = 0; force < 2; force++) {
404  // if we go through all entities and can't find one to free,
405  // override the normal minimum times before use
406  e = &g_entities[MAX_CLIENTS];
407  for (i = MAX_CLIENTS; i < level.num_entities; i++, e++) {
408  if (e->inuse) {
409  continue;
410  }
411 
412  // the first couple seconds of server time can involve a lot of
413  // freeing and allocating, so relax the replacement policy
414  if (!force && e->freetime > level.startTime + 2000 && level.time - e->freetime < 1000) {
415  continue;
416  }
417 
418  // reuse this slot
419  G_InitGentity(e);
420  return e;
421  }
422  if (level.num_entities < ENTITYNUM_MAX_NORMAL) {
423  break;
424  }
425  }
426  if (level.num_entities == ENTITYNUM_MAX_NORMAL) {
427  for (i = 0; i < MAX_GENTITIES; i++) {
428  G_Printf("%4i: %s\n", i, g_entities[i].classname);
429  }
430  G_Error("G_Spawn: no free entities");
431  }
432 
433  // open up a new slot
434  level.num_entities++;
435 
436  // let the server system know that there are more entities
437  trap_LocateGameData(level.gentities, level.num_entities, sizeof(gentity_t),
438  &level.clients[0].ps, sizeof(level.clients[0]));
439 
440  G_InitGentity(e);
441  return e;
442 }

References level_locals_t::clients, ENTITYNUM_MAX_NORMAL, gentity_s::freetime, g_entities, G_Error(), G_InitGentity(), G_Printf(), level_locals_t::gentities, gentity_s::inuse, level, MAX_CLIENTS, MAX_GENTITIES, NULL, level_locals_t::num_entities, gclient_s::ps, level_locals_t::startTime, level_locals_t::time, and trap_LocateGameData().

634 {
635  // allow calls to G_Spawn*()
636  level.spawning = qtrue;
637  level.numSpawnVars = 0;
638 
639  // the worldspawn is not an actual entity, but it still
640  // has a "spawn" function to perform any global setup
641  // needed by a level (setting configstrings or cvars, etc)
642  if (!G_ParseSpawnVars()) {
643  G_Error("SpawnEntities: no entities");
644  }
645  SP_worldspawn();
646 
647  // parse ents
648  while (G_ParseSpawnVars()) {
649  G_SpawnGEntityFromSpawnVars();
650  }
651 
652  level.spawning = qfalse; // any future calls to G_Spawn*() will be errors
653 }

◆ G_TempEntity()

gentity_t* G_TempEntity ( vec3_t  origin,
int  event 
)

G_TempEntity spawns an event temporary entity that will be auto-removed.

The origin will be snapped to save net bandwidth, so care must be taken if the origin is right on a surface (snap towards start vector first).

Parameters
origin
event
Returns
The event temporary entity.

Definition at line 502 of file g_utils.c.

503 {
504  gentity_t* e;
505  vec3_t snapped;
506 
507  e = G_Spawn();
508  e->s.eType = ET_EVENTS + event;
509 
510  e->classname = "tempEntity";
511  e->eventTime = level.time;
512  e->freeAfterEvent = qtrue;
513 
514  VectorCopy(origin, snapped);
515  SnapVector(snapped); // save network bandwidth
516  G_SetOrigin(e, snapped);
517 
518  // find cluster for PVS
519  trap_LinkEntity(e);
520 
521  return e;
522 }

References gentity_s::classname, ET_EVENTS, entityState_s::eType, gentity_s::eventTime, gentity_s::freeAfterEvent, G_SetOrigin(), G_Spawn(), level, qtrue, gentity_s::s, SnapVector, level_locals_t::time, trap_LinkEntity(), and VectorCopy.

Referenced by AddTeamScore(), Blocked_Door(), Bullet_Fire(), CheckGauntletAttack(), ClientDisconnect(), ClientSpawn(), G_Sound(), player_die(), RespawnItem(), ScorePlum(), SendPendingPredictableEvents(), Team_CaptureFlagSound(), Team_ReturnFlagSound(), Team_TakeFlagSound(), TeleportPlayer(), Touch_Item(), Weapon_LightningFire(), weapon_railgun_fire(), and weapon_supershotgun_fire().

◆ G_TouchTriggers()

void G_TouchTriggers ( gentity_t *  ent)

Definition at line 239 of file g_active.c.

240 {
241  int i, num;
242  int touch[MAX_GENTITIES];
243  gentity_t* hit;
244  trace_t trace;
245  vec3_t mins, maxs;
246  static vec3_t range = { 40, 40, 52 };
247 
248  if (!ent->client) {
249  return;
250  }
251 
252  // dead clients don't activate triggers!
253  if (ent->client->ps.stats[STAT_HEALTH] <= 0) {
254  return;
255  }
256 
257  VectorSubtract(ent->client->ps.origin, range, mins);
258  VectorAdd(ent->client->ps.origin, range, maxs);
259 
260  num = trap_EntitiesInBox(mins, maxs, touch, MAX_GENTITIES);
261 
262  // can't use ent->absmin, because that has a one unit pad
263  VectorAdd(ent->client->ps.origin, ent->r.mins, mins);
264  VectorAdd(ent->client->ps.origin, ent->r.maxs, maxs);
265 
266  for (i = 0; i < num; i++) {
267  hit = &g_entities[touch[i]];
268 
269  if (!hit->touch && !ent->touch) {
270  continue;
271  }
272  if (!(hit->r.contents & CONTENTS_TRIGGER)) {
273  continue;
274  }
275 
276  // ignore most entities if a spectator
277  if (ent->client->sess.sessionTeam == TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
278  if (hit->s.eType != ET_TELEPORT_TRIGGER &&
279  // this is ugly but adding a new ET_? type will
280  // most likely cause network incompatibilities
281  hit->touch != Touch_DoorTrigger) {
282  continue;
283  }
284  }
285 
286  // use separate code for determining if an item is picked up
287  // so you don't have to actually contact its bounding box
288  if (hit->s.eType == ET_ITEM) {
289  if (!BG_PlayerTouchesItem(&ent->client->ps, &hit->s, level.time)) {
290  continue;
291  }
292  } else {
293  if (!trap_EntityContact(mins, maxs, hit)) {
294  continue;
295  }
296  }
297 
298  memset(&trace, 0, sizeof(trace));
299 
300  if (hit->touch) {
301  hit->touch(hit, ent, &trace);
302  }
303 
304  if ((ent->r.svFlags & SVF_BOT) && (ent->touch)) {
305  ent->touch(ent, hit, &trace);
306  }
307  }
308 
309  // if we didn't touch a jump pad this pmove frame
310  if (ent->client->ps.jumppad_frame != ent->client->ps.pmove_framecount) {
311  ent->client->ps.jumppad_frame = 0;
312  ent->client->ps.jumppad_ent = 0;
313  }
314 }

References BG_PlayerTouchesItem(), gentity_s::client, entityShared_t::contents, CONTENTS_TRIGGER, ET_ITEM, ET_TELEPORT_TRIGGER, entityState_s::eType, g_entities, playerState_s::jumppad_ent, playerState_s::jumppad_frame, level, MAX_GENTITIES, entityShared_t::maxs, entityShared_t::mins, playerState_s::origin, playerState_s::pmove_framecount, gclient_s::ps, gentity_s::r, gentity_s::s, gclient_s::sess, clientSession_t::sessionTeam, STAT_HEALTH, playerState_s::stats, SVF_BOT, entityShared_t::svFlags, TEAM_SPECTATOR, level_locals_t::time, gentity_s::touch, Touch_DoorTrigger(), trap_EntitiesInBox(), trap_EntityContact(), VectorAdd, and VectorSubtract.

◆ PickTeam()

team_t PickTeam ( int  ignoreClientNum)

Definition at line 598 of file g_client.c.

599 {
600  int counts[TEAM_NUM_TEAMS];
601 
602  counts[TEAM_BLUE] = TeamCount(ignoreClientNum, TEAM_BLUE);
603  counts[TEAM_RED] = TeamCount(ignoreClientNum, TEAM_RED);
604 
605  if (counts[TEAM_BLUE] > counts[TEAM_RED]) {
606  return TEAM_RED;
607  }
608  if (counts[TEAM_RED] > counts[TEAM_BLUE]) {
609  return TEAM_BLUE;
610  }
611  // equal team count, so join the team with the lowest score
612  if (level.teamScores[TEAM_BLUE] > level.teamScores[TEAM_RED]) {
613  return TEAM_RED;
614  }
615  return TEAM_BLUE;
616 }

◆ player_die()

void player_die ( gentity_t *  self,

gentity_t *  attacker,

)

Definition at line 440 of file g_combat.c.

441 {
442  gentity_t* ent;
443  int anim;
444  int contents;
445  int killer;
446  int i;
447  char* killerName, * obit;
448 
449  if (self->client->ps.pm_type == PM_DEAD) {
450  return;
451  }
452 
453  if (level.intermissiontime) {
454  return;
455  }
456 
457  // check for an almost capture
458  CheckAlmostCapture(self, attacker);
459  // check for a player that almost brought in cubes
460  CheckAlmostScored(self, attacker);
461 
462  if (self->client && self->client->hook) {
463  Weapon_HookFree(self->client->hook);
464  }
465 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
466  if ((self->client->ps.eFlags & EF_TICKING) && self->activator) {
467  self->client->ps.eFlags &= ~EF_TICKING;
468  self->activator->think = G_FreeEntity;
469  self->activator->nextthink = level.time;
470  }
471 #endif
472  self->client->ps.pm_type = PM_DEAD;
473 
474  if (attacker) {
475  killer = attacker->s.number;
476  if (attacker->client) {
477  killerName = attacker->client->pers.netname;
478  } else {
479  killerName = "<non-client>";
480  }
481  } else {
482  killer = ENTITYNUM_WORLD;
483  killerName = "<world>";
484  }
485 
486  if (killer < 0 || killer >= MAX_CLIENTS) {
487  killer = ENTITYNUM_WORLD;
488  killerName = "<world>";
489  }
490 
491  if (meansOfDeath < 0 || meansOfDeath >= ARRAY_LEN(modNames)) {
492  obit = "<bad obituary>";
493  } else {
494  obit = modNames[meansOfDeath];
495  }
496 
497  G_LogPrintf("Kill: %i %i %i: %s killed %s by %s\n",
498  killer, self->s.number, meansOfDeath, killerName,
499  self->client->pers.netname, obit);
500 
501  // broadcast the death event to everyone
502  ent = G_TempEntity(self->r.currentOrigin, EV_OBITUARY);
503  ent->s.eventParm = meansOfDeath;
504  ent->s.otherEntityNum = self->s.number;
505  ent->s.otherEntityNum2 = killer;
506  ent->r.svFlags = SVF_BROADCAST; // send to everyone
507 
508  self->enemy = attacker;
509 
510  self->client->ps.persistant[PERS_KILLED]++;
511 
512  if (attacker && attacker->client) {
513  attacker->client->lastkilled_client = self->s.number;
514 
515  if (attacker == self || OnSameTeam(self, attacker)) {
516  AddScore(attacker, self->r.currentOrigin, -1);
517  } else {
518  AddScore(attacker, self->r.currentOrigin, 1);
519 
520  if (meansOfDeath == MOD_GAUNTLET) {
521 
522  // play humiliation on player
523  attacker->client->ps.persistant[PERS_GAUNTLET_FRAG_COUNT]++;
524 
525  // add the sprite over the player's head
526  attacker->client->ps.eFlags &= ~(EF_AWARD_IMPRESSIVE | EF_AWARD_EXCELLENT | EF_AWARD_GAUNTLET | EF_AWARD_ASSIST | EF_AWARD_DEFEND | EF_AWARD_CAP);
527  attacker->client->ps.eFlags |= EF_AWARD_GAUNTLET;
528  attacker->client->rewardTime = level.time + REWARD_SPRITE_TIME;
529 
530  // also play humiliation on target
531  self->client->ps.persistant[PERS_PLAYEREVENTS] ^= PLAYEREVENT_GAUNTLETREWARD;
532  }
533 
534  // check for two kills in a short amount of time
535  // if this is close enough to the last kill, give a reward sound
536  if (level.time - attacker->client->lastKillTime < CARNAGE_REWARD_TIME) {
537  // play excellent on player
538  attacker->client->ps.persistant[PERS_EXCELLENT_COUNT]++;
539 
540  // add the sprite over the player's head
541  attacker->client->ps.eFlags &= ~(EF_AWARD_IMPRESSIVE | EF_AWARD_EXCELLENT | EF_AWARD_GAUNTLET | EF_AWARD_ASSIST | EF_AWARD_DEFEND | EF_AWARD_CAP);
542  attacker->client->ps.eFlags |= EF_AWARD_EXCELLENT;
543  attacker->client->rewardTime = level.time + REWARD_SPRITE_TIME;
544  }
545  attacker->client->lastKillTime = level.time;
546 
547  }
548  } else {
549  AddScore(self, self->r.currentOrigin, -1);
550  }
551 
552  // Add team bonuses
553  Team_FragBonuses(self, inflictor, attacker);
554 
555  // if I committed suicide, the flag does not fall, it returns.
556  if (meansOfDeath == MOD_SUICIDE) {
557  if (self->client->ps.powerups[PW_NEUTRALFLAG]) { // only happens in One Flag CTF
558  Team_ReturnFlag(TEAM_FREE);
559  self->client->ps.powerups[PW_NEUTRALFLAG] = 0;
560  } else if (self->client->ps.powerups[PW_REDFLAG]) { // only happens in standard CTF
561  Team_ReturnFlag(TEAM_RED);
562  self->client->ps.powerups[PW_REDFLAG] = 0;
563  } else if (self->client->ps.powerups[PW_BLUEFLAG]) { // only happens in standard CTF
564  Team_ReturnFlag(TEAM_BLUE);
565  self->client->ps.powerups[PW_BLUEFLAG] = 0;
566  }
567  }
568 
569  TossClientItems(self);
570 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
571  TossClientPersistantPowerups(self);
572  if (g_gametype.integer == GT_HARVESTER) {
573  TossClientCubes(self);
574  }
575 #endif
576 
577  Cmd_Score_f(self); // show scores
578  // send updated scores to any clients that are following this one,
579  // or they would get stale scoreboards
580  for (i = 0; i < level.maxclients; i++) {
581  gclient_t* client;
582 
583  client = &level.clients[i];
584  if (client->pers.connected != CON_CONNECTED) {
585  continue;
586  }
587  if (client->sess.sessionTeam != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
588  continue;
589  }
590  if (client->sess.spectatorClient == self->s.number) {
591  Cmd_Score_f(g_entities + i);
592  }
593  }
594 
595  self->takedamage = qtrue; // can still be gibbed
596 
597  self->s.weapon = WP_NONE;
598  self->s.powerups = 0;
599  self->r.contents = CONTENTS_CORPSE;
600 
601  self->s.angles[0] = 0;
602  self->s.angles[2] = 0;
603  LookAtKiller(self, inflictor, attacker);
604 
605  VectorCopy(self->s.angles, self->client->ps.viewangles);
606 
607  self->s.loopSound = 0;
608 
609  self->r.maxs[2] = -8;
610 
611  // don't allow respawn until the death anim is done
612  // g_forcerespawn may force spawning at some later time
613  self->client->respawnTime = level.time + 1700;
614 
615  // remove powerups
616  memset(self->client->ps.powerups, 0, sizeof(self->client->ps.powerups));
617 
618  // never gib in a nodrop
619  contents = trap_PointContents(self->r.currentOrigin, -1);
620 
621  if ((self->health <= GIB_HEALTH && !(contents & CONTENTS_NODROP) && g_blood.integer) || meansOfDeath == MOD_SUICIDE) {
622  // gib death
623  GibEntity(self, killer);
624  } else {
625  // normal death
626  static int i;
627 
628  switch (i) {
629  case 0:
630  anim = BOTH_DEATH1;
631  break;
632  case 1:
633  anim = BOTH_DEATH2;
634  break;
635  case 2:
636  default:
637  anim = BOTH_DEATH3;
638  break;
639  }
640 
641  // for the no-blood option, we need to prevent the health
642  // from going to gib level
643  if (self->health <= GIB_HEALTH) {
644  self->health = GIB_HEALTH + 1;
645  }
646 
647  self->client->ps.legsAnim =
648  ((self->client->ps.legsAnim & ANIM_TOGGLEBIT) ^ ANIM_TOGGLEBIT) | anim;
649  self->client->ps.torsoAnim =
650  ((self->client->ps.torsoAnim & ANIM_TOGGLEBIT) ^ ANIM_TOGGLEBIT) | anim;
651 
652  G_AddEvent(self, EV_DEATH1 + i, killer);
653 
654  // the body can still be gibbed
655  self->die = body_die;
656 
657  // globally cycle through the different death animations
658  i = (i + 1) % 3;
659 
660 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
661  if (self->s.eFlags & EF_KAMIKAZE) {
662  Kamikaze_DeathTimer(self);
663  }
664 #endif
665  }
666 
667  trap_LinkEntity(self);
668 
669 }

References AddScore(), ANIM_TOGGLEBIT, ARRAY_LEN, body_die(), BOTH_DEATH1, BOTH_DEATH2, BOTH_DEATH3, CARNAGE_REWARD_TIME, CheckAlmostCapture(), CheckAlmostScored(), gentity_s::client, level_locals_t::clients, Cmd_Score_f(), CON_CONNECTED, clientPersistant_t::connected, CONTENTS_CORPSE, CONTENTS_NODROP, entityShared_t::currentOrigin, EF_AWARD_ASSIST, EF_AWARD_CAP, EF_AWARD_DEFEND, EF_AWARD_EXCELLENT, EF_AWARD_GAUNTLET, EF_AWARD_IMPRESSIVE, EF_KAMIKAZE, playerState_s::eFlags, ENTITYNUM_WORLD, EV_DEATH1, EV_OBITUARY, entityState_s::eventParm, G_AddEvent(), g_blood, g_entities, G_FreeEntity(), g_gametype, G_LogPrintf(), G_TempEntity(), GIB_HEALTH, GibEntity(), GT_HARVESTER, vmCvar_t::integer, level_locals_t::intermissiontime, gclient_s::lastkilled_client, gclient_s::lastKillTime, level, LookAtKiller(), MAX_CLIENTS, level_locals_t::maxclients, MOD_GAUNTLET, MOD_SUICIDE, modNames, clientPersistant_t::netname, entityState_s::number, OnSameTeam(), entityState_s::otherEntityNum, entityState_s::otherEntityNum2, gclient_s::pers, PERS_EXCELLENT_COUNT, PERS_GAUNTLET_FRAG_COUNT, PERS_KILLED, PERS_PLAYEREVENTS, playerState_s::persistant, PLAYEREVENT_GAUNTLETREWARD, PM_DEAD, gclient_s::ps, PW_BLUEFLAG, PW_NEUTRALFLAG, PW_REDFLAG, qtrue, gentity_s::r, REWARD_SPRITE_TIME, gclient_s::rewardTime, gentity_s::s, gclient_s::sess, clientSession_t::sessionTeam, clientSession_t::spectatorClient, SVF_BROADCAST, entityShared_t::svFlags, TEAM_BLUE, Team_FragBonuses(), TEAM_FREE, TEAM_RED, Team_ReturnFlag(), TEAM_SPECTATOR, level_locals_t::time, TossClientCubes(), TossClientItems(), trap_LinkEntity(), trap_PointContents(), VectorCopy, Weapon_HookFree(), and WP_NONE.

◆ SetTeam()

void SetTeam ( gentity_t *  ent,
const char *  s 
)

Definition at line 518 of file g_cmds.c.

519 {
520  int team, oldTeam;
521  gclient_t* client;
522  int clientNum;
523  spectatorState_t specState;
524  int specClient;
525  int teamLeader;
526 
527  //
528  // see what change is requested
529  //
530  client = ent->client;
531 
532  clientNum = client - level.clients;
533  specClient = 0;
534  specState = SPECTATOR_NOT;
535  if (!Q_stricmp(s, "scoreboard") || !Q_stricmp(s, "score")) {
536  team = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
537  specState = SPECTATOR_SCOREBOARD;
538  } else if (!Q_stricmp(s, "follow1")) {
539  team = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
540  specState = SPECTATOR_FOLLOW;
541  specClient = -1;
542  } else if (!Q_stricmp(s, "follow2")) {
543  team = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
544  specState = SPECTATOR_FOLLOW;
545  specClient = -2;
546  } else if (!Q_stricmp(s, "spectator") || !Q_stricmp(s, "s")) {
547  team = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
548  specState = SPECTATOR_FREE;
549  } else if (g_gametype.integer >= GT_TEAM) {
550  // if running a team game, assign player to one of the teams
551  specState = SPECTATOR_NOT;
552  if (!Q_stricmp(s, "red") || !Q_stricmp(s, "r")) {
553  team = TEAM_RED;
554  } else if (!Q_stricmp(s, "blue") || !Q_stricmp(s, "b")) {
555  team = TEAM_BLUE;
556  } else {
557  // pick the team with the least number of players
558  team = PickTeam(clientNum);
559  }
560 
561  if (g_teamForceBalance.integer && !client->pers.localClient && !(ent->r.svFlags & SVF_BOT)) {
562  int counts[TEAM_NUM_TEAMS];
563 
564  counts[TEAM_BLUE] = TeamCount(clientNum, TEAM_BLUE);
565  counts[TEAM_RED] = TeamCount(clientNum, TEAM_RED);
566 
567  // We allow a spread of two
568  if (team == TEAM_RED && counts[TEAM_RED] - counts[TEAM_BLUE] > 1) {
569  trap_SendServerCommand(clientNum,
570  "cp \"Red team has too many players.\n\"");
571  return; // ignore the request
572  }
573  if (team == TEAM_BLUE && counts[TEAM_BLUE] - counts[TEAM_RED] > 1) {
574  trap_SendServerCommand(clientNum,
575  "cp \"Blue team has too many players.\n\"");
576  return; // ignore the request
577  }
578 
579  // It's ok, the team we are switching to has less or same number of players
580  }
581 
582  } else {
583  // force them to spectators if there aren't any spots free
584  team = TEAM_FREE;
585  }
586 
587  // override decision if limiting the players
588  if ((g_gametype.integer == GT_TOURNAMENT)
589  && level.numNonSpectatorClients >= 2) {
590  team = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
591  } else if (g_maxGameClients.integer > 0 &&
592  level.numNonSpectatorClients >= g_maxGameClients.integer) {
593  team = TEAM_SPECTATOR;
594  }
595 
596  //
597  // decide if we will allow the change
598  //
599  oldTeam = client->sess.sessionTeam;
600  if (team == oldTeam && team != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
601  return;
602  }
603 
604  //
605  // execute the team change
606  //
607 
608  // if the player was dead leave the body, but only if they're actually in game
609  if (client->ps.stats[STAT_HEALTH] <= 0 && client->pers.connected == CON_CONNECTED) {
610  CopyToBodyQue(ent);
611  }
612 
613  // he starts at 'base'
614  client->pers.teamState.state = TEAM_BEGIN;
615  if (oldTeam != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
616  // Kill him (makes sure he loses flags, etc)
617  ent->flags &= ~FL_GODMODE;
618  ent->client->ps.stats[STAT_HEALTH] = ent->health = 0;
619  player_die(ent, ent, ent, 100000, MOD_SUICIDE);
620 
621  }
622 
623  // they go to the end of the line for tournements
624  if (team == TEAM_SPECTATOR && oldTeam != team)
625  AddTournamentQueue(client);
626 
627  client->sess.sessionTeam = team;
628  client->sess.spectatorState = specState;
629  client->sess.spectatorClient = specClient;
630 
631  client->sess.teamLeader = qfalse;
632  if (team == TEAM_RED || team == TEAM_BLUE) {
633  teamLeader = TeamLeader(team);
634  // if there is no team leader or the team leader is a bot and this client is not a bot
635  if (teamLeader == -1 || (!(g_entities[clientNum].r.svFlags & SVF_BOT) && (g_entities[teamLeader].r.svFlags & SVF_BOT))) {
636  SetLeader(team, clientNum);
637  }
638  }
639  // make sure there is a team leader on the team the player came from
640  if (oldTeam == TEAM_RED || oldTeam == TEAM_BLUE) {
641  CheckTeamLeader(oldTeam);
642  }
643 
644  // get and distribute relevant parameters
645  ClientUserinfoChanged(clientNum);
646 
647  // client hasn't spawned yet, they sent an early team command, teampref userinfo, or g_teamAutoJoin is enabled
648  if (client->pers.connected != CON_CONNECTED) {
649  return;
650  }
651 
652  BroadcastTeamChange(client, oldTeam);
653 
654  ClientBegin(clientNum);
655 }

References AddTournamentQueue(), BroadcastTeamChange(), CheckTeamLeader(), gentity_s::client, ClientBegin(), level_locals_t::clients, ClientUserinfoChanged(), CON_CONNECTED, clientPersistant_t::connected, CopyToBodyQue(), FL_GODMODE, gentity_s::flags, g_entities, g_gametype, g_maxGameClients, g_teamForceBalance, GT_TEAM, GT_TOURNAMENT, gentity_s::health, vmCvar_t::integer, level, clientPersistant_t::localClient, MOD_SUICIDE, level_locals_t::numNonSpectatorClients, gclient_s::pers, PickTeam(), player_die(), gclient_s::ps, Q_stricmp(), qfalse, gentity_s::r, s, gclient_s::sess, clientSession_t::sessionTeam, SetLeader(), SPECTATOR_FOLLOW, SPECTATOR_FREE, SPECTATOR_NOT, SPECTATOR_SCOREBOARD, clientSession_t::spectatorClient, clientSession_t::spectatorState, STAT_HEALTH, playerTeamState_t::state, playerState_s::stats, SVF_BOT, entityShared_t::svFlags, TEAM_BEGIN, TEAM_BLUE, TEAM_FREE, TEAM_NUM_TEAMS, TEAM_RED, TEAM_SPECTATOR, TeamCount(), clientSession_t::teamLeader, TeamLeader(), clientPersistant_t::teamState, and trap_SendServerCommand().

◆ SpawnModelsOnVictoryPads()

void SpawnModelsOnVictoryPads ( void  )

331 {
332  gentity_t* player;

778

783  } else {

809 }

87 
88  noAngles = (angles[0] > 999999.0);
89  // use temp events at source and destination to prevent the effect
90  // from getting dropped by a second player event
91  if (player->client->sess.sessionTeam != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
92  tent = G_TempEntity(player->client->ps.origin, EV_PLAYER_TELEPORT_OUT);
93  tent->s.clientNum = player->s.clientNum;
94 
95  tent = G_TempEntity(origin, EV_PLAYER_TELEPORT_IN);
96  tent->s.clientNum = player->s.clientNum;
97  }
98

101

103  player->client->ps.origin[2] += 1;
104  if (!noAngles) {
105  // spit the player out
106  AngleVectors(angles, player->client->ps.velocity, NULL, NULL);
107  VectorScale(player->client->ps.velocity, 400, player->client->ps.velocity);
108  player->client->ps.pm_time = 160; // hold time
109  player->client->ps.pm_flags |= PMF_TIME_KNOCKBACK;
110  // set angles
111  SetClientViewAngle(player, angles);
112  }
113  // toggle the teleport bit so the client knows to not lerp
114  player->client->ps.eFlags ^= EF_TELEPORT_BIT;
115  // kill anything at the destination
116  if (player->client->sess.sessionTeam != TEAM_SPECTATOR) {
117  G_KillBox(player);
118  }

122

127  trap_LinkEntity(player);
128  }

◆ TossClientItems()

void TossClientItems ( gentity_t *  self)

Definition at line 78 of file g_combat.c.

79 {
80  gitem_t* item;
81  int weapon;
82  float angle;
83  int i;
84  gentity_t* drop;
85 
86  // drop the weapon if not a gauntlet or machinegun
87  weapon = self->s.weapon;
88 
89  // make a special check to see if they are changing to a new
90  // weapon that isn't the mg or gauntlet. Without this, a client
91  // can pick up a weapon, be killed, and not drop the weapon because
92  // their weapon change hasn't completed yet and they are still holding the MG.
93  if (weapon == WP_MACHINEGUN || weapon == WP_GRAPPLING_HOOK) {
94  if (self->client->ps.weaponstate == WEAPON_DROPPING) {
95  weapon = self->client->pers.cmd.weapon;
96  }
97  if (!(self->client->ps.stats[STAT_WEAPONS] & (1 << weapon))) {
98  weapon = WP_NONE;
99  }
100  }
101 
102  if (weapon > WP_MACHINEGUN&& weapon != WP_GRAPPLING_HOOK &&
103  self->client->ps.ammo[weapon]) {
104  // find the item type for this weapon
105  item = BG_FindItemForWeapon(weapon);
106 
107  // spawn the item
108  Drop_Item(self, item, 0);
109  }
110 
111  // drop all the powerups if not in teamplay
112  if (g_gametype.integer != GT_TEAM) {
113  angle = 45;
114  for (i = 1; i < PW_NUM_POWERUPS; i++) {
115  if (self->client->ps.powerups[i] > level.time) {
116  item = BG_FindItemForPowerup(i);
117  if (!item) {
118  continue;
119  }
120  drop = Drop_Item(self, item, angle);
121  // decide how many seconds it has left
122  drop->count = (self->client->ps.powerups[i] - level.time) / 1000;
123  if (drop->count < 1) {
124  drop->count = 1;
125  }
126  angle += 45;
127  }
128  }
129  }
130 }

References BG_FindItemForPowerup(), BG_FindItemForWeapon(), gentity_s::count, Drop_Item(), g_gametype, GT_TEAM, level, PW_NUM_POWERUPS, gentity_s::s, STAT_WEAPONS, level_locals_t::time, entityState_s::weapon, WEAPON_DROPPING, WP_GRAPPLING_HOOK, WP_MACHINEGUN, and WP_NONE.

Referenced by ClientDisconnect(), and player_die().

◆ Touch_Item()

void Touch_Item ( gentity_t *  ent,
gentity_t *  other,
trace_t *  trace 
)

Definition at line 429 of file g_items.c.

430 {
431  int respawn;
432  qboolean predict;
433 
434  if (!other->client)
435  return;
436  if (other->health < 1)
437  return; // dead people can't pickup
438 
439  // the same pickup rules are used for client side and server side
440  if (!BG_CanItemBeGrabbed(g_gametype.integer, &ent->s, &other->client->ps)) {
441  return;
442  }
443 
444  G_LogPrintf("Item: %i %s\n", other->s.number, ent->item->classname);
445 
446  predict = other->client->pers.predictItemPickup;
447 
448  // call the item-specific pickup function
449  switch (ent->item->giType) {
450  case IT_WEAPON:
451  respawn = Pickup_Weapon(ent, other);
452  // predict = qfalse;
453  break;
454  case IT_AMMO:
455  respawn = Pickup_Ammo(ent, other);
456  // predict = qfalse;
457  break;
458  case IT_ARMOR:
459  respawn = Pickup_Armor(ent, other);
460  break;
461  case IT_HEALTH:
462  respawn = Pickup_Health(ent, other);
463  break;
464  case IT_POWERUP:
465  respawn = Pickup_Powerup(ent, other);
466  predict = qfalse;
467  break;
468 #ifdef MISSIONPACK
469  case IT_PERSISTANT_POWERUP:
470  respawn = Pickup_PersistantPowerup(ent, other);
471  break;
472 #endif
473  case IT_TEAM:
474  respawn = Pickup_Team(ent, other);
475  break;
476  case IT_HOLDABLE:
477  respawn = Pickup_Holdable(ent, other);
478  break;
479  default:
480  return;
481  }
482 
483  if (!respawn) {
484  return;
485  }
486 
487  // play the normal pickup sound
488  if (predict) {
489  G_AddPredictableEvent(other, EV_ITEM_PICKUP, ent->s.modelindex);
490  } else {
491  G_AddEvent(other, EV_ITEM_PICKUP, ent->s.modelindex);
492  }
493 
494  // powerup pickups are global broadcasts
495  if (ent->item->giType == IT_POWERUP || ent->item->giType == IT_TEAM) {
496  // if we want the global sound to play
497  if (!ent->speed) {
498  gentity_t* te;
499 
500  te = G_TempEntity(ent->s.pos.trBase, EV_GLOBAL_ITEM_PICKUP);
501  te->s.eventParm = ent->s.modelindex;
502  te->r.svFlags |= SVF_BROADCAST;
503  } else {
504  gentity_t* te;
505 
506  te = G_TempEntity(ent->s.pos.trBase, EV_GLOBAL_ITEM_PICKUP);
507  te->s.eventParm = ent->s.modelindex;
508  // only send this temp entity to a single client
509  te->r.svFlags |= SVF_SINGLECLIENT;
510  te->r.singleClient = other->s.number;
511  }
512  }
513 
514  // fire item targets
515  G_UseTargets(ent, other);
516 
517  // wait of -1 will not respawn
518  if (ent->wait == -1) {
519  ent->r.svFlags |= SVF_NOCLIENT;
520  ent->s.eFlags |= EF_NODRAW;
521  ent->r.contents = 0;
522  ent->unlinkAfterEvent = qtrue;
523  return;
524  }
525 
526  // non zero wait overrides respawn time
527  if (ent->wait) {
528  respawn = ent->wait;
529  }
530 
531  // random can be used to vary the respawn time
532  if (ent->random) {
533  respawn += crandom() * ent->random;
534  if (respawn < 1) {
535  respawn = 1;
536  }
537  }
538 
539  // dropped items will not respawn
540  if (ent->flags & FL_DROPPED_ITEM) {
541  ent->freeAfterEvent = qtrue;
542  }
543 
544  // picked up items still stay around, they just don't
545  // draw anything. This allows respawnable items
546  // to be placed on movers.
547  ent->r.svFlags |= SVF_NOCLIENT;
548  ent->s.eFlags |= EF_NODRAW;
549  ent->r.contents = 0;
550 
551  // ZOID
552  // A negative respawn times means to never respawn this item (but don't
553  // delete it). This is used by items that are respawned by third party
554  // events such as ctf flags
555  if (respawn <= 0) {
556  ent->nextthink = 0;
557  ent->think = 0;
558  } else {
559  ent->nextthink = level.time + respawn * 1000;
560  ent->think = RespawnItem;
561  }
562  trap_LinkEntity(ent);
563 }

References BG_CanItemBeGrabbed(), gitem_s::classname, gentity_s::client, entityShared_t::contents, crandom, EF_NODRAW, entityState_s::eFlags, EV_GLOBAL_ITEM_PICKUP, EV_ITEM_PICKUP, entityState_s::eventParm, FL_DROPPED_ITEM, gentity_s::flags, gentity_s::freeAfterEvent, G_AddEvent(), G_AddPredictableEvent(), g_gametype, G_LogPrintf(), G_TempEntity(), G_UseTargets(), gitem_s::giType, gentity_s::health, IT_AMMO, IT_ARMOR, IT_HEALTH, IT_HOLDABLE, IT_PERSISTANT_POWERUP, IT_POWERUP, IT_TEAM, IT_WEAPON, gentity_s::item, level, entityState_s::modelindex, gentity_s::nextthink, entityState_s::number, gclient_s::pers, Pickup_Ammo(), Pickup_Armor(), Pickup_Health(), Pickup_Holdable(), Pickup_Powerup(), Pickup_Team(), Pickup_Weapon(), entityState_s::pos, clientPersistant_t::predictItemPickup, gclient_s::ps, qfalse, qtrue, gentity_s::r, gentity_s::random, RespawnItem(), gentity_s::s, entityShared_t::singleClient, gentity_s::speed, SVF_BROADCAST, SVF_NOCLIENT, SVF_SINGLECLIENT, entityShared_t::svFlags, gentity_s::think, level_locals_t::time, trap_LinkEntity(), trajectory_t::trBase, gentity_s::unlinkAfterEvent, and gentity_s::wait.

◆ trap_AdjustAreaPortalState()

void trap_AdjustAreaPortalState ( gentity_t *  ent,
qboolean  open 
)

Adjusts the state of a portal connecting two areas.

Set "open" to true to allow visibility through the portal and false to block visibility. This is normally used to adjust visibility when opening and closing doors. When the door is open; "open" is set true and entities are visible through the door, when the door is closed; "open" is set false and trap_InPVS will not see entities through the door. See Use_BinaryMover in the game source for an example.

Parameters
entEntity to adjust.
openState to adjust to.

Definition at line 528 of file g_syscalls.c.

529 {
530  syscall(G_ADJUST_AREA_PORTAL_STATE, ent, open);
531 }

References G_ADJUST_AREA_PORTAL_STATE.

Referenced by Reached_BinaryMover(), and Use_BinaryMover().

int  area2 
)

This functions tests whether or not the areas (presumably leaf nodes of the bsp tree) are adjacent physically.

FIXME: the values of area1 and area2 are unknown, however.

Parameters
area1First area to test.
area2Second area to test.
Returns

Definition at line 541 of file g_syscalls.c.

543  return syscall(G_AREAS_CONNECTED, area1, area2);
544 }

◆ trap_Argc()

int trap_Argc ( void  )

Whenever a client issues a console command it can have arguments passed with it.

Returns
The number of arguments identically to the argc found in C programs with this prototype for main: int main( int argc, char **argv ).

◆ trap_Argv()

void trap_Argv ( int  n,
char *  buffer,
int  bufferLength 
)

This will fill the buffer pointed to by buffer with an argument to a client command where n is the argument to return.

0 is the command itself, 1 is the first argument and so on... Very similiar to char **argv in a C program.

Parameters
nThe argument number to return.
bufferA point to a buffer to fill.
bufferLengthThe size of the buffer.

Definition at line 106 of file cg_syscalls.c.

107 {
108  syscall(CG_ARGV, n, buffer, bufferLength);
109 }

◆ trap_BotAllocateClient()

int trap_BotAllocateClient ( void  )

Allocates a free client slot and returns the client number.

Also marks the client as bot in the engine (arg2 will be 1 when a GAME_CLIENT_CONNECT message is dispatched to vmMain for this client).

On failure, -1 is returned.

◆ trap_Cvar_Register()

void trap_Cvar_Register ( vmCvar_t *  cvar,
const char *  var_name,
const char *  value,
int  flags 
)

This function is used to create a new vmCvar.

It sends all the information to the engine's main database and then it stores a local copy of the data into the vmCvar_t passed as the first argument.

Parameters
cvarA pointer the location in which to store the local data.
var_nameA null-terminated string that will be used to set the vmCvar's name field.
valueA null-terminated string that will be used to set both the floating point and integer value fields of the vmCvar.
flags?.

Definition at line 62 of file cg_syscalls.c.

63 {
64  syscall(CG_CVAR_REGISTER, vmCvar, varName, defaultValue, flags);
65 }

◆ trap_Cvar_Set()

void trap_Cvar_Set ( const char *  var_name,
const char *  value 
)

This function searchs for the name of the vmCvar and stores the value into both the float and integer fields of the corresponding vmCvar entry.

The only way to effectly change the value of a vmCvar is to use this function, the ANSI storage operator only modifies the local buffer and not the "master copy".

Parameters
var_nameA null-terminated string containing the name of the vmCvar to set.
valueA null-terminated string containing the desired value.

Definition at line 72 of file cg_syscalls.c.

73 {
74  syscall(CG_CVAR_SET, var_name, value);
75 }

◆ trap_Cvar_Update()

void trap_Cvar_Update ( vmCvar_t *  cvar)

This function first parses out the name of the vmCvar and then searches for the corresponding database entry.

Once it finds the vmCvar it will copy the "master copy" of the vmCvar into the local address provided.

Parameters
cvarA pointer to the vmCvar to update.

Definition at line 67 of file cg_syscalls.c.

68 {
69  syscall(CG_CVAR_UPDATE, vmCvar);
70 }

◆ trap_Cvar_VariableIntegerValue()

int trap_Cvar_VariableIntegerValue ( const char *  var_name)

This function returns the integer value of var_name that is currently stored in the "master copy".

Parameters
var_nameA null-terminated string containing the name of the vmCvar to retrieve a value from.
Returns
The integer value of var_name that is currently stored in the "master copy".

References G_CVAR_VARIABLE_INTEGER_VALUE.

Referenced by BotAISetupClient(), BotSetupDeathmatchAI(), G_InitGame(), G_ItemDisabled(), G_LoadBots(), G_RankGameOver(), G_ShutdownGame(), PodiumPlacementThink(), SpawnPodium(), and Svcmd_AddBot_f().

◆ trap_Cvar_VariableStringBuffer()

void trap_Cvar_VariableStringBuffer ( const char *  var_name,
char *  buffer,
int  bufsize 
)

This trap copies the content of a cvar named by var_name into a mod-space string.

This is useful for obtaining cvar contents that are not bound, or cannot be bound, to a vmCvar_t variable in the mod code.

The terminating NULL is attached to the end of the copied string by this trap, guaranteeing buffer holds a null-terminated string. The total number of characters copied, including terminating NULL, fits within the size specified by bufsize, truncating the string if necessary.

A nonexistent cvar provides an empty string. An existing cvar with empty content also provides an empty string. Thus, this trap is not sufficient to determine if a cvar actually exists or not.

This trap does not create a new cvar; to create a new cvar during run-time, you can use trap_Cvar_Set or trap_SendConsoleCommand.

Parameters
var_namename of cvar (console variable).
bufferdestination string buffer.
bufsizemaximum limit of string buffer.
var_name
buffer
bufsizeThis is useful for obtaining cvar contents that are not bound, or cannot be bound, to a vmCvar_t variable in the mod code.

The terminating NULL is attached to the end of the copied string by this trap, guaranteeing buffer holds a null-terminated string. The total number of characters copied, including terminating NULL, fits within the size specified by bufsize, truncating the string if necessary.

A nonexistent cvar provides an empty string. An existing cvar with empty content also provides an empty string. Thus, this trap is not sufficient to determine if a cvar actually exists or not.

This trap does not create a new cvar; to create a new cvar during run-time, you can use trap_Cvar_Set or trap_SendConsoleCommand.

Parameters
var_namename of cvar (console variable).
bufferdestination string buffer.
bufsizemaximum limit of string buffer.
var_name
buffer
bufsize

Definition at line 96 of file cg_syscalls.c.

97 {
98  syscall(CG_CVAR_VARIABLESTRINGBUFFER, var_name, buffer, bufsize);
99 }

◆ trap_Cvar_VariableValue()

float trap_Cvar_VariableValue ( const char *  var_name)

Definition at line 54 of file g_bot.c.

55 {
56  char buf[128];
57 
58  trap_Cvar_VariableStringBuffer(var_name, buf, sizeof(buf));
59  return atof(buf);
60 }

◆ trap_DebugPolygonCreate()

int trap_DebugPolygonCreate ( int  color,
int  numPoints,
vec3_t *  points 
)

Creates a solid coloured permanent polygon in the renderer (and world) based on the given array of vertices/points.

it returns a reference handle to the polygon as it appears in the renderlist. This function should be disabled, but it may still work.

In Q3 1.31, only a single debug polygon can be displayed at once. Calling trap_DebugPolygonCreate() to draw a second polygon causes none of them to be drawn on the screen. Delete the old polygon before trying to draw the new one.

Parameters
color
numPoints
points
Returns

Definition at line 669 of file g_syscalls.c.

670 {
671  return syscall(G_DEBUG_POLYGON_CREATE, color, numPoints, points);
672 }

◆ trap_EntitiesInBox()

int trap_EntitiesInBox ( const vec3_t  mins,
const vec3_t  maxs,
int *  list,
int  maxcount 
)

This fills an array of ints with the entity numbers (ent->s.number) of all the entities currently within the cuboid defined by mins and maxs.

Two vectors - mins and maxs - to be passed in, representing the extents (or farthest points) of an invisible box in the world of Q3.

Parameters
[in]minsThe position of the corner of a cuboid.
[in]maxsThe position of the opposite corner of this cuboid.
[in,out]listA array of integers(entityNum's (entity indices)) to hold any entities that positively past the test for existence within the boxs boundaries.
[in]maxcountThe maximum amount of entities that will be returned by the parameter, list.
Returns
The number of all entities that were successfully found in the box.

◆ trap_FS_FOpenFile()

int trap_FS_FOpenFile ( const char *  qpath,
fileHandle_t *  f,
fsMode_t  mode 
)

This opens a file specified by the string qpath and allocates a fileHandle_t (just a typedef int) to that file.

This is then used in subsequent operations involving the file. The fsMode_t enumeration refers to the mode the file is opened in. FS_READ for reading the file. FS_WRITE will create the file qpath if it doesn't exist or 0 length it if it does. FS_APPEND allows writing to the end of an existing file. FS_APPEND_SYNC is similar to FS_APPEND except you can read from the file at the same time.

An int is returned representing the length of the file being opened.

Parameters
qpathThe file to be opened.
fReference to a local fileHandle_t.
modeMode to open the file in.
Returns

Definition at line 116 of file cg_syscalls.c.

117 {
118  return syscall(CG_FS_FOPENFILE, qpath, f, mode);
119 }

◆ trap_GetUserinfo()

void trap_GetUserinfo ( int  num,
char *  buffer,
int  bufferSize 
)

Each client has a "user info" string which is a backslash delimited key/value pair for the various options the user can set.

For example, model, skin and weapon colour. trap_GetUserinfo fills the buffer pointed to by *buffer with the userinfo of the client referenced by num. Key values are then retrieved using Info_ValueForKey( buffer, keyname ).

Parameters
numclientNum of the userinfo to retrieve.
bufferPointer to a buffer to fill.
bufferSizeSize of the buffer.

◆ trap_InPVS()

qboolean trap_InPVS ( const vec3_t  p1,
const vec3_t  p2 
)

Returns true if point1 can potentially see point2.

Two points can return true, but not be visible to each other due to detail brushes, curves, etc. A return value of false guarantees that the points can not see each other. Normally used to test if two entities can potentially see each other, point1 would be the currentOrigin of the first entitiy and point2 the currentOrigin of the second entity. This function relies on the Potentially Visible Set, and areaportal data generated during the BSP compiling of a map.

Parameters
p1Absolute coordinates of point 1.
p2Absolute coordinates of point 2.
Returns

Definition at line 498 of file g_syscalls.c.

499 {
500  return syscall(G_IN_PVS, p1, p2);
501 }

References G_IN_PVS.

Referenced by Team_FragBonuses(), and Team_GetLocation().
